intro: Synaphea acutiloba, commonly known as the sharp-lobed synaphea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature in the Apiaceae family. The leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
